description.narrative: By 2016, social policies, including the strategy of implementation of the national social protection policy, taking into account the specific needs of women and children are developed and implemented, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2010-2018 - Outcome 6 / Cross-sectoral programme: National monitoring and evaluation structures provide reliable data for monitoring SDGs and other national goals and advocacy for children and women by the end of 2016

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs Technical staff services

Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, social policies, including the strategy of implementation of the national social protection policy, taking into account the specific needs of women and children are developed and implemented

description.narrative: UNICEF Burundi continued supporting implementation of the National Strategy on Social Protection, developed in 2015, through strengthening the capacity of the Permanent Executive Secretary of the National Social Protection Commission, including analysing the institutional framework, establishing a monitoring and evaluation system and developing a communication plan. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018
